folder: Mercer Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
15 to 27 Mercer Street, west side, south of and towards Grand Street. No. 15-17, at the left, which is not quite entirely included in the picture, is a six-story loft building, faced with iron, of a type which began to be built in the 1870's. No. 19 is a brick loft building, faced with stone, of the type built during and shortly after the Civil War, in the 1860's. Mercer Street is the first of a group of seven streets parallel to and west of Broadway.

About 1915.

Fires, Accidents and Tragedies: Modern fire apparatus extinguishing a blaze at No. 51 Mercer Street, a five story building between Grand and Broome Street's.

July 6, 1939
No's. 1-2

P. L. Sperr
title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire in building.]
